record.title: AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET
record.narrative:
AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET -- (Senate - September 18, 2008)

[Page: S9042]

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE, SCIENCE, AND TRANSPORTATION
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at 2:30 p.m., in room 253 of the Russell Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC WORKS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Environment and Public Works be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at 10 a.m., in room 406 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building to hold a hearing entitled "Oversight Hearing on Cleanup Efforts at Federal Facilities."

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Foreign Relations be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at 2:30 p.m.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY AND GOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at a time to be determined.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate Committee on the Judiciary be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate, to conduct an executive business meeting on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at 10 a.m. in room SH-216 of the Hart Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Indian Affairs be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, at 9:30 a.m. in room 562 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Select Committee on Intelligence be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008 at 2:30 p.m. to hold a closed hearing.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: SUBCOMMITTEE ON OVERSIGHT OF GOVERNMENT MANAGEMENT, THE FEDERAL WORKFORCE, AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs' Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Thursday, September 18, 2008, at 2 p.m. to conduct a hearing entitled "Keeping the Nation Safe through the Presidential Transition."

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: SUBCOMMITTEE ON SECURITIES, INSURANCE, AND INVESTMENT
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Subcommittee on Securities, Insurance, and Investment be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on September 18, 2008, at 2:30 p.m., to conduct a hearing entitled "Transparency in Accounting: Proposed Changes to Accounting for Off-Balance Sheet Entities."

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
